intro: Hibbertia stricta var. oblonga, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a shrub characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces vibrant yellow flowers with prominent, showy stamens, which attract pollinators such as bees and birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in heathlands and dry forests. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within the Dilleniaceae family.
